required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of LAS 34273 in Patients With Moderate to Severe Stable Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease(COPD)

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of LAS 34273 compared to placebo in patients with moderate to severe COPD during one year of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Trough FEV1 (L) at 28 Weeks on Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Trough FEV1 (mean FEV1 value of the two highest FEV1 readings measured at 23 and 24 hours after inhalation) at 28 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Trough FEV1 (L) at 12 Weeks on Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Trough FEV1 (mean FEV1 value of the two highest FEV1 readings measured at 23 and 24 hours after inhalation) at 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Moderate or Severe COPD Exacerbation at 52 Weeks on Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first moderate or severe exacerbation: Increase of COPD symptoms during at least 2 consecutive days, treated with antibiotics and/or systemic corticosteroids or an increase in dose of systemic corticosteroids, or leading to hospitalisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved at Least a 4-unit Decrease From Baseline in the SGRQ Total Score at 52 Weeks on Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who achieved a clinically relevant improvement in health-related quality of life at 52 weeks, as measured by at least a 4-unit decrease from baseline in St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) total score

arm_group.description: Aclidinium bromide 200 μg once-daily by inhalation

intervention.description: Aclidinium bromide 200 μg once-daily via inhalation by the Eklira Genuair® inhaler: 1 puff in the morning for 52 weeks
Placebo once-daily via inhalation: 1 puff in the morning for 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females aged ≥ 40 years with a clinical diagnosis of moderate to severe stable COPD
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or current diagnosis of asthma, recent respiratory tract infection or acute COPD exacerbation, life expectancy of less than 1 year, known symptomatic prostatic hypertrophy, bladder neck obstruction or narrow-angle glaucoma

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted in a total of 119 enrolling sites: 72 sites in the United States, 13 sites in Argentina, 13 sites in Australia, 7 sites in Canada, 2 sites in Mexico, 3 sites in New Zealand and 9 sites in South Africa. The first patient was screened in August 2006 and the last patient visit was in June 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Following a screening visit, patients entered a 14-day run-in period during which they used inhaled salbutamol on an as needed basis. Patients also stopped taking any other COPD medications prohibited by the study protocol. The 14-day run-in period was used to assess the stability of disease and established the patient’s baseline characteristics.

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200 μg Once-daily
group.description: Aclidinium bromide 200 μg once-daily by inhalation

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200 μg Once-daily
group.description: Aclidinium bromide 200 μg once-daily by inhalation

outcome.title: Trough FEV1 (L) at 28 Weeks on Treatment
outcome.description: Trough FEV1 (mean FEV1 value of the two highest FEV1 readings measured at 23 and 24 hours after inhalation) at 28 weeks
outcome.population: Intention-to-Treat (ITT) population: all randomised patients who took at least one dose of Investigational Medicinal Product and had at least the baseline and one post-baseline value available for the primary efficacy variable.

measurement_list.measurement: The median time to first moderate or severe COPD exacerbation could not be estimated for either group since fewer than 50% of the population had experienced a moderate or severe exacerbation.
The median time to first moderate or severe COPD exacerbation could not be estimated for either group since fewer than 50% of the population had experienced a moderate or severe exacerbation.

outcome.population: Intention-to-Treat (ITT) population: all randomised patients who took at least one dose of Investigational Medicinal Product and had at least the baseline and one post-baseline value available for the primary efficacy variable.

reported_events.desc: Only COPD exacerbations that were fatal or life-threatening are included here. Other COPD exacerbations were not reported as AEs but were included as part of the efficacy evaluations.

group.title: Aclidinium Bromide 200 μg Once-daily
group.description: Aclidinium bromide 200 μg once-daily by inhalation

event.description: Two patients, one in each group, reported pneumonia that was considered to be a non-treatment-emergent SAE experienced after discontinuation of study medication.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.description: One patient in the placebo group experienced respiratory failure that was a non-treatment emergent SAE experienced after discontinuation of study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All the information related to this clinical trial is considered strictly confidential and is the property of Almirall. This information will not be given to a third party without the written consent of Almirall. Publication and/or presentation, whether complete or partial, of any part of the data or results of this trial will be subject to revision and written agreement between the investigator and Almirall.
